website_summaries.verdict: A reliable machine that produces juice at a fraction of the price of other models.
pros: Unique auto-reversing reamer and final spin function effectively extracts juice
cons: Doesn't juice as fast as more expensive models, but value price makes it worth the wait

customer_reviews.title: Not working as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Something is not right.. not happy with it. Want a new one or get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart is going down hill.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Cuisinart is going down hill. Very noisy and sounds like it will not last long. Gear box is loose and sounds like nothing but plastic. Product arrived in a box that looked re-taped. There was one small blemish on unit that really wasn't a big deal. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't like pulp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had good reviews, I watched the demonstration video, and read the proclamations about "pulp control" and thought it sounded great. But I am severely disappointed. There is no pulp control whatsoever. The reaming mechanism works really well to clean out the citrus fruit; however, the pulp filter plugs up and does not let the juice run through, then you run the pulp spinner feature, which I thought sounded really cool, but all it does is put the pulp back into your juice, and the juice goes everywhere because even the drain spout is plugged with pulp.
customer_reviews.author: T. Orth

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We have always like Cuisinart small appliances ( have a toaster oven and coffee maker), so we thought this would be a good choice for a juicer. Bought in on Dec. 28 and it stopped working on April 7, so just a little over 3 months. That last day it juiced one orange and then motor stopped. It would not work again. BEWARE: Warranty is for 3 years supposedly, but you have to send $10 in for return shipping (it costs $21.84) so it wasn't worth returning it. I will nee to think long and hard about getting another Cuisinart appliance.
customer_reviews.author: lb97471

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to return this but it was too late- only 30 days! That should've tipped me off not to buy it in the first place. I don't why this has any positive reviews. It is very difficult to clean and useless as a juicer, you may as well just use a manual, inexpensive one instead. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect juicer
customer_reviews.text: Pros : - Sleek design -Modern look -Easy to clean -Powerful -Get everything clean -Catch the pulp -Prevent seeds from falling -Great for citrus Cons : -None I was able to juice grapefuits , orange and lemon effortlessly. Overall i m truly impress with this product . I use to do everything manually and i would waste so much .This machine gets everything clean . Doesn't waste a thing Would i recommend it to my friends ? Yes Would i purchase an other one ? Yes
customer_reviews.author: reshiram

customer_reviews.title: Two of these juicers stopped working after limited use
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two of these and they both broke within a short period of time. The first stopped working after a few months of occasional use, and the second failed tonight after squeezing only four limes. The second one was BRAND NEW and was being used for the first time. Thinking the juicer might have a built-in circuit to prevent overheating during use (even though I barely started using it), I let it sit for a half hour and tried again but it still did not work. I am very disappointed with this juicer and will be looking for a different one. I have generally been happy with Cuisinart products, so this experience was a real let-down.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn D.

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE GENIUS
customer_reviews.text: As with other Cuisinart appliances I own, the emphasis with this juicer is simplicity and efficiency. It makes quick work of oranges, grapefruits, lemons and limes. It is simple to clean easy to store and produces great juice. The only suggestion I would have for Cuisinart might be the addition of a second, a smaller juicer head for lemons and limes, although this would increase the cost. Right now, this is a reasonable price for what you get. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Perry C.

customer_reviews.title: buy another juicer
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst juicer. It clogs fast so yo have to stop and clean it all out, its messy, its really a piece of junk. I hate this juicer and regret wasting money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Curry

customer_reviews.title: SO HAPPY WITH MY PURCHASE!!
customer_reviews.text: We own 7 citrus trees on our property so when It is citrus season, we have a ton to juice! Originally I bought the Dash juicer because it was recommended my America’s Test Kitchen ... BIG MISTAKE. The motor died after 3 uses. This was recommended on Instagram by the Social Media Manager of Williams Sonoma. She was buying it as an Xmas gift For her family. We’ve had it only a few months but it has been amazing .... hard working motor that doesn’t quit, easy cleanup, and simple to use. It has a setting to adjust the pulp as well. I’m thrilled with my purchase! And my family is thrilled to have fresh squeezed juice!
customer_reviews.author: ShO

customer_reviews.title: Used it last night for the first time and was ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it last night for the first time and was very impressed!!! The oranges and lemons released a ton of juice to the rind and clean up was a breeze- I just don't understand the negative reviews posted! I live in Florida and will be juicing frequently so I'll post in month to update this review!!! Naples - Florida
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H

customer_reviews.title: Centrifuge Switch Failed after just 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The internal switch that activates the high speed spin feature failed after 6 months of daily use. The juicer spin mode turned on all by itself one evening. Fortunately, we were in the kitchen at the time, and were able to unplug the juicer. The switch area was getting hot, and a little puff of smoke appeared. The switched was "on" even though nothing was pressing the switch. My multi-meter showed that the switch was closed even though the it was physically open. Looks like some orange juice contaminated the switch, as the switch button showed corrosion. A citrus juicer should not be susceptible to orange juice, Doh!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Even with this problem I'd buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I juice a couple of lemons a day for my whiskey sours. I bought the Cuisinart juicer in August and it quit functioning as designed in April. So I got 8 months of daily use before something happened to the on/off function. It's supposed to turn on when you push the lemon down on the juicer and off when you take the pressure off. But now it stays on all the time when plugged in. I did a workaround by plugging the device into an external on/off switch. This works fine, so I intend to keep using it in this configuration until it dies at which time I'll gladly buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hempe

customer_reviews.title: The true WORKHORSE of juicers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this juicer as we end up with a bumper crop of Grapefruit every year. I liked the reviews and simplicity of this juicer. Trust me it will not disappoint and I have put it through GALLOBS of juicing! You will get tired before this thing quits it's that durable. It's easy to clean and well made. Very simple design (we use it without the hood) leaves empty fruit halves piled up in the trash quick. Really enjoying this juicer I've had this for 3 years now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great product
customer_reviews.text: I have an orange tree that produces 100 - 200 oranges every year. I gave lots away and still couldn't juice all of them with my hand juicer so was looking for an electric model and saw this one. Now I can produce 2 cups of oj in about a minute without tired hands. It works great and is easy to clean. I've been using mine for several weeks with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Cop3

customer_reviews.title: Plup Clogs Machine
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this product to arrive as I want to start making fresh orange juice for the family. I find the pulp control hard to use. The pulp clogs the spout where the juice is suppose to flow into your glass. Have to use a curved pick to keep the juice flowing. Also product did not come in an amazon box it just came in the products box with an amazon label stuck to it. Disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: JenniferValentina

customer_reviews.title: The item works great for juicing citrus
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up because the house next door has an orange tree and we started getting free fruit from them. The item works great for juicing citrus, but I have two minor nitpicks; there doesn't seem to be a way to specifically pick which direction to make the unit spin so sometimes you just have to keep pressing it to get it to go in reverse, and the "low pulp" setting on the dial still generates a LOT of pulp. I wish there were a secondary strainer you could place below the cone to catch more of the orange pieces, but a strainer works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve listen to the bad reviews! Save your time!!! Don’t trust all the good reviews!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this juicer would help me juice faster than doing it manually but it takes same amount of time and same effort, I still had to hold the orange and squeeze it to get the juice out!!! Totally Defeats the purpose of electric juicer! Very disappointed in this product! I bought it based on the reviews and the brand but they are both disappointing I don’t know if I can trust these reviews anymore.. Returning this item! Save your time and don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, we use it frequently for lemons, limes and oranges. Small or large fruits are easily handled. The alternating motor directions doesn't always happen with each start/stop, but I do not find this to be a problem...it does a very good job and is easy to use. The final 'extractor' spin is excellent. A loved tool in our kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: M. Merksamer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This does work so much better than a manual squeezer. I especially love the spin cycle to get the last drops and easy to clean parts. While the lemons and limes are so cheap I an using this every day or 2 to make another full pitcher. Only takes 4 limes or lemons, 1 cup of Stevia and a few minutes to make it. My only comment is that the stainless finish shows finger prints. Not the same stainless shiny finish as on my Cuisinart coffee maker. Sun tea is out. Limonada is in for the rest of the summer.
customer_reviews.author: GaryGTX

customer_reviews.title: It does its job!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, no frills device. I add lemon, lime, orange and pineapple juice to my gym water every day. This little juicer gets all the juice out of the fruit. The pulp control aspect is good but not total. It isn't a lot of pulp though even with pineapples. I haven't tried it on anything else yet. I've had it a month, use it every couple of days and it has been a good little machine. Definitely a good starter for someone who falls down rabbit holes or a casual juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Beekeeping Bear

customer_reviews.title: Love the simplicity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend and our home bar, we use it for everything all the time now, lemons, oranges, limes, grapefruit, anything we can put on there. I almost bought a very expensive electric juicer and I'm so glad I got this one instead it is a perfect size and super easy to clean too!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Weak motor, a lot of work required to operate.
customer_reviews.text: FOr some reason I got the impression that this had some degree of automation to it. I thought I just had to inster the citrus half and close the lid nad the machine would juice it for me. Basically, it's the exact same thing as your grandmother's juicer but with a very weak motor attached. You still have to press down really hard, manipulate the fruit back, forth and sideways, and as the motor winds down and almost stops, my wrist and fingers get really sore as I have AS - a type of arthritis. I'm disappointed. It doesn't relieve me of much of the work I had to put into my old fashioned manual juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to clean. Very happy overall.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Very easy to use and fairly easy to clean. Everything pops right off without any effort the only thing that makes it semi difficult to clean is the filter part that separates the pulp... That would be with any citrus juicer. This one at least comes apart so you can clean each piece separately. I also like the fact that you can control how much pulp goes into your orange juice or other juice. A win for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Angello

customer_reviews.title: Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Another brand I had previously worked great. I bought this one because they don't make the other one anymore. Such a disappointment. Even the small top is too big for small lemons. It slides, Is hard to clean, the gears make noises when you take pressure off, then it is hard to keep the lemon on when it reverses directions.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this juicer
customer_reviews.text: the top plastic part of this juicer is not made well and I guess I got what I paid for. I would not recommend this juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Horrible to Clean
customer_reviews.text: The strainer part of this has a deeply curved lip with little room to get your finger in there to clean it out. Imagine pulp that wraps around the holes, you can't get to it, and even a good water sprayer will not blast it out. Took me 20 minutes to get all of the pulp off.
customer_reviews.author: OnLineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Last year we retired to a warm climate and found a citrus tree in our new back yard. It turned out to be oranges. Lots. And lots. Of oranges. We've been picking them for 3 months already, encouraging our friends and neighbors to take them too. But still SO MANY oranges! We have been making Orange Everything, and since we have an extra freezer we thought we could also juice the oranges and enjoy it anytime during the year. Hand juicing was NOT doing the job. We ordered this product. It is reasonably priced, has easy-to-clean pieces, self-reverses, and gets the job done. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and use
customer_reviews.text: So much better than manually juicing lemons. I like the automatic reverse feature to get more juice out the lemon. The spout is too short and you can not get glass close enough to fully put it under the spout. I did not like that Amazon did not put it in a box and left it m y my steps. The box was exposed and it was wet outside.
customer_reviews.author: 12RedAlert

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, very less power and waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Its pulp control feature is excellent but i hate everything else in it. Its stops spinning and makes loud noise if u apply even little bit of pressure. Now bcus you can’t apply pressure it takes forever to juice. I almost spent 30 mins or more to juice just 12 oranges. Time waste. I should have bought those old fashioned manual juicers that juice by applying pressure. This is very disappointing and time waste. Inly use could be to spend time with kids by letting them use it. Kids love it and its safe too due to plastic parts and low power spinner.
customer_reviews.author: vinay

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best impulse buy ive ever made. Its so insanely easy to use and clean. Got 2 full cups of juice using 4 navel oranges. Oh my goodness is it yummy! If you are looking for a citrus juicer look no further, this is not only super affordable but works super well.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't have improved my new model any better!
customer_reviews.text: I used my Cuisinart juicer for over 15 years and would probably still be using it if I hadn't dropped it The new model is really easy to clean. It spins faster to extract more juice from the pulp. It is 3 way adjustable too. One of my biggest complaints was the spacing from spout to container on my old model and I had to put a rubber mat under it to keep it from turning and wasting the juice. The new model has an indent for the glass and a longer spout and better feet to avoid the juicer from spinning while juicing.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: This Citrus Juicer is so good I want to get two!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I can I always try to buy fresh oranges for drinking my OJs there is nothing like it you cannot really compare 🙌🏽 This Citrus Juicer is so good I seriously want to get two! That's how good this is! #nojoke Now given that is is my first owned Citrus juicer maybe but I'm really happy with it, before I had to squeeze (manually with old school squeezer) 4 oranges to get 1 glass but with this gadget it only took 2 oranges 👏🏽🙌🏽😁 plus it really wipes those pulps out, see photos. I'm happy customer! Thank you 🙏🏽😁
customer_reviews.author: piamomia

customer_reviews.title: Great machine with problems.
customer_reviews.text: I love this juicer! So much that when my first two failed in the same way I just ordered a new one rather then pursuing the warranty. To get a new one under the warranty will cost you more then buying a new one at Amazon. Both my other juicers failed by being stuck in spin. must be a congenital defect. but I love it so much I ordered my new one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Worden

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is super easy to clean and juices as quickly as any other citrus juicer I've used (with three citrus trees in the yard I've tried lots). Time will tell whether it will continue to perform. The price was good. Some reviews say it juices as fast or faster than slicing the fruit, which I found not to be true, but I don't think you could find a faster one outside of a commercial model and certainly not for the price.
customer_reviews.author: LJR

customer_reviews.title: A good 4 year life
customer_reviews.text: My trusted friend passed away today. We’ve been through many times over the past four years: oranges, grapefruit, lemons, and limes. She saw me through more margaritas than I can even count. I used and abused her several days every week, year after year, and she kept coming back for more. It’s true, you don’t know what you have till it’s gone. Rest in peace my friend. And please don’t judge me when I replace you with someone exactly like you... the same model number.
customer_reviews.author: CasssieJWJ

customer_reviews.title: Works just as described
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to juice lemons in the morning to start off my day or fresh orange juice on the weekends and it works great. Oh and if you make ceviche you know that you need a lot of lemons. This beauty makes it so easy to get all the juice you need fast. I have had this juicer for two months now and it cleans easy and is still going strong. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable durability
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use, but horrible durability. It started making ugly sounds six weeks after purchase, as if a gear or similar was about to break. Now, eight weeks after purchase, the noise is unbearable and sometimes the juicer is simply not working (no rotation). The juicer has been used only during weekends for making orange juice. Even at this low price, this product was a disappointment. I would like to return it, but Amazon offers no instruction in this regard.
customer_reviews.author: Hans H.

customer_reviews.title: Really gets all the juice
customer_reviews.text: We've juiced citrus a lot. We've tried a lot of juicers. This is the best one, yet. It really does get all the juice out. It is so strong, it will even strip the inside of the orange, leaving you holding only the rind. I love the auto reverse feature. And the high speed spin to get all juice out of the juicer is inspired- it really works like they say.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job but too messy
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is for.. take out all the juice from the Lemons. I find it too noisy, it vibrates a lot, and at the end you have a lot of drops o Lemmon on. You cuz it spills up. You have to push with your hand without a cover. I use a lot a limes I easily squeeze 10-15 lbs a week for my daily use and This machine is not what I expected. I have to wash my hands every time to take away the juice and the skin juice cuz it gets slippery and the you can’t do it.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Adriana

customer_reviews.title: This is the one...
customer_reviews.text: In my quest to make great craft cocktails, fresh citrus juice in modest quantities is an important ingredient. I've tried many electric citrus juicers as well as the hand varieties, and this is now my go-to juicer. One of my favorite features is the spin cycle, which ensures that all of the juice that has been extracted from the fruit makes it out of the machine and into your container. When you're done, cleanup is easy. For the price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: tango1050

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose, however it’s not a power house strong juicer. It leaves a lot of the orange juice within the orange still, I have them squeezed it manually to retrieve the last drops. When left open to retrieve pulp it gets clogged up, so just be aware, but it sill juices. Like I said it’s serving it’s purpose, for beginners with natural juicing, ya go for it, but don’t expect it to juice a hole gallon for your family. It’s $26, it shouldn’t kill your bank account. It’s a good start.
customer_reviews.author: Colochos (curly hair in Spanish)

customer_reviews.title: Messy and time consuming
customer_reviews.text: Juicing navel oranges. The first 3 oranges juice well. After that it clogs up. Must scrape out the basket to continue. Also it requires a container to catch the juice. Neither container nor juicing machine stay in one place for long, making a mess. Can't fit a pitcher under the spout to receive the juice. Best I could do was fit a mixing bowl under it. Requires too much clean up. Thankfully I saved my old black and decker juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Roo

customer_reviews.title: I am tickled pink to have this nifty appliance!
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart CCJ-500 Pulp Control Citrus Juicer, Brushed Stainless, Black/Stainless works well and is easy to clean. I think it is a really good deal for the price. It is faster, less messy, and easier on the hands than using a hand-held press or a manual juicer. The noise level seems appropriate to me . . . I have never heard of a silent motorized juicer! Also, it looks nice enough to sit out on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: love this juicer
customer_reviews.text: We have a lemon tree that produces tons of lemons. When we are over run with lemons we like to freeze the juice to make lemonade later. This electric juicer has changed our juicing lives. It is so easy and so convenient. It is comes apart easily to clean. We have had no problems with it and we are very, very happy that we invested in this electric juicer. It is worth it if you have a lot of juicing to do.
customer_reviews.author: jeanneserenity

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A JOKE!
customer_reviews.text: One size only does not work for all the different shapes of citrus! I returned it and pulled out my old one that may not look as sleek looking but came with two sizes (large & small), the juice goes down into a pitcher, which has a spout and a cover for storing on the fridge. THIS PRODUCT HAD NONE OF THAT! DONT BOTHER WITH THIS JUICER!
customer_reviews.author: John E. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this about 3 times a week for the last month and I’m so impressed. It’s so easy to clean since everything comes apart from the main base. It’s extremely easy to use and I have a six year old helper for orange juice. The only thing for those who don’t like pulp is you’re definitely still going to get pulp in your OJ even on the no pulp setting. Not a problem for us since we love pulp.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer29109

customer_reviews.title: Really love this juicer
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to order this juicer based on some negative reviews but glad I did. It works great. I realized the complaints of it being noisy were unfounded. If you push down firmly when juicing the sound is negligible. If you don’t there is a loud grinding sound. That said, it takes a bit of muscle to push down firmly enough and I end up using both hands. But I get every bit of juice. Very happy with this juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent juicer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this due to the abundance of citrus fruits where I live and it is so worth it. The juice out of this machine is so much better than store-bought and no unwanted tastes make it through. I most frequently juice oranges, blood oranges and grapefruits (including large ones) and does the job well. The fast spin feature to clean out the press when it's filling with tissue is very useful. It's nice to alter the pulp level, although I leave it set to medium all the time. It's very easy to clean. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jones

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to buy one?!?
customer_reviews.text: I kept telling myself I didn't need a juicer, but since my neighbour has been gifting me with oranges for the last month, I scrambled to eat them all before they became moldy. I never had enough at once to jam, but had too much to consume. I buckled and bought this inexpensive juicer and I'm so glad I did! Juicing is a breeze, clean up is a breeze, and it doesn't take a crazy amount of space on my counter, though I'll probably just put it away soon.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for a bargain-priced juicer
customer_reviews.text: I like the feature where it doesn't just go in one direction. It seems to get the juice out better. My dad's a citrus farmer, so I've used a few different kinds. This one isn't made out of the best materials, but it's pretty, and it's a good bargain-priced model if you aren't going to use it every day. Another fun feature is that you can decide how much pulp you want.
customer_reviews.author: KrisZ.

customer_reviews.title: Only relevant for physically weak people
customer_reviews.text: This is a motorized juicer with an ordinary plastic reamer at the top that rotates under power. If you are weak-armed, you might find the power assist useful, but anyone with normal strength will not notice any improvement over just twisting the fruit over a reamer from the supermarket. As far as manual reaming technology goes, I would consider the Oxo wooden reamer to be far superior to this device and would recommend a cast iron juice press as a way better option for fast and complete juicing. Currently I use the plastic reamer as a bottle filling stand and plan to salvage the motor out of this device because it is hard to find high torque motors.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: we love it! we have been trying to drink less boxed juice and more freshly squeezed and this has made it so much easier! we have gone through a couple of these, mostly cheeper walmart versions and they always end up breaking down a week into using. This one on the other hand straight out of the box looked more sturdy! it has already been more than a month of constant daily use even our 2 year old helps and we have had no problems! LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand because of its overall good reviews. I had used another brand for years and was satisficed, but swayed by the great reviews. The height of the juicer and spout is inconvenient - I cannot fit a regular glass under the spout, and have to use very small glasses or a coffee mug to catch the juice. The filtering system is not very good- the pulp jams up the wholes, making for non-drainage after juicing a few oranges. Clean-up is also more difficult- the strainer is difficult to wash. I will now hunt for my original juicer and trash this one.
customer_reviews.author: lmir

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Unit I purchased doesn't spin as it is supposed to when you place the clear plastic cover on it to get the just out of the remaining pulp. Cheaply made would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joi

customer_reviews.title: Great Juicer
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly great product for the price. Subtle features like the slightly off-center spin of the juicing bulb (to help smash all fruit in oblong half semispheres of fruit) to the reverse spin feature that is achieved with a quick 2nd press make it very nice. It's quiet- you can carry on a conversation while it runs. But don't expect silence. The parts are easily cleaned and leave the main unit entirely free of pulp and sugar when they are removed for cleaning in your dishwasher. This juicers is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: coralia hanson

customer_reviews.title: A cheap and ok Citrus Juicer.
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is more or less ok for the money. it has several drawbacks. The hole for the juice is super small and quickly gets clogged with pulp. You have to push the oranges down pretty hard; doing more than two cups a juice is tiring. The strainer also quickly gets clogged with pulp and needs cleaning. Overall I'd look for a better designed juicer if I was thinking of keeping it long term.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando A. Brucher

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for my mom
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought a manual one but this thing and Im not gone lie is pretty awesome as my mom deals with allot of pain from osteoporosis,carpal tunnel hand syndrom,arthritis.Well needless to say dad cuts the citrus and mom loves the power and how it extracts all the juice and seperates the pulp.Now her second favorite appliance next to her convection oven!
customer_reviews.author: Thesaved1one

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Received it this morning and used it immediately (well, washed the moving parts with soap and water). Super easy to use, and it works exceptionally well with oranges and grapefruits. Compared to a model I had before - with a built-in extraction container - it feels like a much more powerful and sturdier construction. I like that the moving parts are so easy to take apart to clean, there was virtually no mess. The instructional video was very helpful, I did not know about the final spin you can do with a clear lid.
customer_reviews.author: lanna

customer_reviews.title: Fresh juice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this juicer in January 2016 and it is still juicing like the first day I used it. I have orange trees and most of the year I make fresh orange juice - 1/2 to 1 gallon a week. I also have lemons and make lemonade and freeze the juice for later use. So this juicer has been used a lot. It's easy to use and easy to clean - dishwasher. Great juicer
customer_reviews.author: arava pet wipes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent juicer by Cuisinart, as I should’ve known!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got a fancy Omega juicer but my husband likes juice with less pulp, so we tried a Black&Decker first. Big mistake! Should’ve gone with the Cuisinart from the beginning. This juicer is lightweight, fairly quiet, and very easy to clean. The ability to stop the flow of juice by moving the spout is great and saved me from spills. Even though it’s one more small appliance for me to find space for, it’s well worth the counter/cupboard space and the price can’t be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Soniced_Up

customer_reviews.title: It works on lemons!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this juicer. I use it solely for lemons. I was concerned after reading the reviews but was so tired of hand juicing them I gave it a shot. I’m smiling while juicing. It is so easy. I cut the lemon down the middle with the stem pointy ends on the ends. I then cut off the rind on the ends so you can see the lemon. Not too much! Then I go to town. It is a little noisy; my cats run but not as bad as a blender. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Little Swan

customer_reviews.title: I was wrong in my first review.  Read this one.
customer_reviews.text: As much as I hate to admit being wrong.... Used this little machine again and have to admit it is really tough. Had a bunch of lemons to juice and this little juicer did a great job. Did not jiggle around the counter but stood fast. Took a bit of a beating because I'm not very gentle. What really impressed me was how each lemon was completely juiced; right down to the last little bit. But I would not recommend using it in the middle of the night because it will wake the neighbors. A bit on the noisy side but I love it just the same.
customer_reviews.author: Evette

customer_reviews.title: Nothing complicated, just a simple, efficient, durable, awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly! We are SO DONE with squeezing citrus by hand. thanks to this gadget - never again. It is FAST too! Just push half citrus down on on the top of it and it spins automatically and drains the juice out through a spout and into your glass. We've had this about a year and use it often. It's been durable, easy to take the top pieces off to clean and it goes back together in 5 seconds. Nothing complicated, just a simple, efficient, awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: WindRider

customer_reviews.title: Not a good juice machine...save your money or buy the more expensive version
customer_reviews.text: Poor design, below average quality, poor application....it gets clogged constantly and uses a large amount of oranges to make 1/2 of a cup of juice. I wish I would have bought the one which was much more expensive . Imagine that....
customer_reviews.author: Sassafrass Pedullah

customer_reviews.title: Best citrus juicer I've come across yet
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a juicer that could get through 100 pounds of oranges I received. Two other brands busted before half way done. Ridiculous. Decided to try a more trusted name brand and about to finish up 500 pounds of citrus and this citrus juicer is going strong!!!! If you want a product that can handle daily citrus juicing this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi Love

customer_reviews.title: Lots of juice!!!
customer_reviews.text: In the picture of my Pyrex jug... that is the yield from 4 California lemons, yes 4!!!! It hollows out the entire lemon. I don’t like pulp, so used the low pulp and it it wonderful. So why only 4 stars? It is HARD to take apart to clean. Goes together super easy though. I was so frustrated taking it apart to clean, but love the juice yield so will deal with that!
customer_reviews.author: Savvy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works well to extract juice.
customer_reviews.text: "Pulp control" is a bit of a stretch. Or perhaps it's an accurate description. Because a ton of pulp makes its way thru to your glass, no matter what setting you chose for the mesh. I just run the juice thru my strainer to filter out the rest. And the spin feature to get all that extra juice out of the pulp catch area is comical. It works, but It just throws a lot more pulp into your glass. Don't get me wrong, I like the juicer. It works fairly easily, extracts all the juice from an orange, and is easy to clean. But you will be doing second level straining unless you enjoy drinking copious amounts of pulp.
customer_reviews.author: DrK

customer_reviews.title: Best juicer ever (for the money)!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this juicer is amazing! I didn't want to spend a lot of money have tried several juicers around this same price. This is the best juicer ever! Not only do I easily get a lot of juice from whatever citrus I use, but it is relatively quiet and easy to clean. I liked it so much I tried to send one to each of my children only to find that I could order only one.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this primarily to extract orange juice (will use for lemons and limes too). I have only had it for a short time, but it has exceeded my expectations. It is easy to use and setup and it extracts a LOT of juice. As long as it holds up for some period of time then I will consider it a very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatist

customer_reviews.title: Moscow Mule Boss
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I love Moscow Mule cocktails and to make them properly you need fresh lime juice. I'll juice up a few limes to make a batch, and this bad boy works great. It gets FAR more juice out of a lime than manual methods and does so quickly. The pieces come apart quickly for a quick rinse and it's ready for the next time. I've bought a couple of these as gifts and recommended them to friends who have also bought them. This one is a high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: and I love the feature of being able to use the lid ...
customer_reviews.text: This citrus juicer works very well, and I love the feature of being able to use the lid to get any remaining juice out of the machine. The alternating spin feature does not work on a regular basis- sometimes it takes a few tries to get it to spin in the other direction, and other times is alternates as it should.
customer_reviews.author: DanaM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and Easy to Clean Up
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting a citrus juicer for quite some time and when I got this one I was excited to use it! It was a super simple setup, easy to use (you don’t need a lot of pressure, and the best part it’s SUPER EASY to clean!!!! It get everything from the oranges and lemons that I have used so far and produces a lot of juice. It has a cool function to control the pulp and it’s not hard to understand. Plus, it’s a nice looking machine.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lazo

customer_reviews.title: works well and fast
customer_reviews.text: Been using for about a week. Have juiced oranges, lemons, and grapefruit. Love that it goes in two directions. You have to hand-hold fruit in place on spinner but does not require much effort. Juices really fast and efficiently. Easy to clean. Does give off a mist of citrus when juicing but that's to be expected without a cover. Certainly worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love this juicer
customer_reviews.text: Used this juicer right out of the box and loved it. Called my neighbor over to watch the magic. Confession: we are in Pensacola, FL and my Dad grows orange trees as a hobby and gives the fruit away. We moved to town and purchased this juicer which arrived immediately. First day 3 quarts of juice. The device offers 3 levels of pulp for your juice. What a wonder! We are are on day 1 so logivety is still in qusetion.
customer_reviews.author: brenda turkel

customer_reviews.title: Barely get a 8 oz OJ without cleaning!
customer_reviews.text: It's impossible to get juice out of more than 2-3 oranges without completely cleaning the juicer. I am okay with the noise but I cannot constantly clean this to make 24oz juice = 3 glasses for the family. I just want a juicer can handle back to back 8-9 oranges every morning. I don't mind cleaning afterwards. As much as I wanted to keep this, it's not going to work for us.
customer_reviews.author: MTEO

customer_reviews.title: Slides all over the counter no rubber bottom
customer_reviews.text: The unit does not have rubber on the bottom so it moves all over the counter which makes it difficult to get the juice in the cup rather than on the counter. I am also not a fan of the way it changes direction on its own. I wish there was a way to lock it in one direction or allow it to change on its own. I loved my last juicer but broke it when I dropped it on my granite counter and was very bummed to find out that Amazon does not carry my old one any more.... please bring back the juicer made by Epica. I would purchase that one 100 times over the cuisinart brand...
customer_reviews.author: Linda Kemph

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price; cumbersome to juice.
customer_reviews.text: The pulp strainer has ridges and it collects more pulp even in high pulp juice setting. Have to empty the pulp for every 3 to 4 oranges or so. Though all parts are machine washable; too many parts to clean. The grips at the bottom of the juicer is not that great. The unit slips easily and creates a mess with juice spilling through the spout. Found it difficult juicing with excited kids around. Returned this unit for a juicer that collects juice in built-in jar (non-spout). Felt the motor is good. I was able to juice one full bag of oranges from Costco about 12 of them in one go.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: makes juicing so much easier
customer_reviews.text: Not that twisting fruit on a manual citrus juicer was difficult, but this tool makes the process so much easier, quicker and more thorough. I love this item and have always loved this brand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Perfection! Easy and fast juice!
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is perfect! It really works to get all the juice, and I love making orange juice because it's so easy and fast! It has a nice cover and it looks classy. It's also easy to clean. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: K.O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to make lemon and OJ by the gallon. This device is so easy to use and clean, I now find it easier to make lemonade fresh when needed. The noise level is very tolerable, also keep in mind you are only using it for 3-5 seconds per half of fruit. Lastly, it makes a lot of juice. I was able to get a bit more than 1.5 cups from 7 lemons. I got a lot less when I used a manual reamer.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: The lid is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The lid in my opinion is useless! I'm not using oranges on steroids! The placement for an orange is not big enough for it to spin with the cone, it causes the motor to bog down and stop spinning. Also, you can't push the lid down enough to reach the inner peel to squeeze the rest of the juice out of a lemon, the motor sounds like its stripping gears...I'm not Thor! Without the lid it's wonderful, luckily the fruit does not spray everywhere with the lid off otherwise this would have been returned. Sorry Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAST / EASY TO CLEAN / WONDERFUL JUICER
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little juicer!! It juices half of a grapefruit in just seconds. I love how the clear top and the black juicing mechanism on top can be easily taken off, washed and put right back on. I was initially hesitant to buy a juicer because I don't like "high maintenance" appliances. I was pleased to find that it worked so well AND was so easily to clean. I can juice an orange, clean this thing off and put back on the storage shelf in under a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Taunya R.

customer_reviews.title: decent orange juicer but only fits short glass/cup
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty easy to use orange juice squeezer (not really a juicer where it process the peels and everything), you need to cut the orange in half and press it against the machine to squeeze the juice out. It works pretty well but the reason for my 3 stars is that the nose (where the juice comes out) is sitting too low on the machine, only a 12oz cup would fit on this machine. If I want to do more than 4 oranges at a time, I'd have to use 2 different cups instead of a bigger cup. Which is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey

customer_reviews.title: You need this in your life!
customer_reviews.text: Wowzers, what an awesome juicer! So easy to use even my kids now enjoy making their own fresh orange juice. Gets every bit of juice from the fruit, cleanup up is a breeze, doesn’t take up any extra space on the counter, and it’s not super loud. Been using it everyday and I don’t know why I hadn’t bought one sooner. Highly recommend 😊
customer_reviews.author: izzy78

customer_reviews.title: Awesome juicer!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome juicer. Easy to use & easy to clean. Bought one for myself & a family member. Trilled with the juicer. Does a great job with mor juice than a hand-held juicer, especially when you use the cover at the end to spin out the pulp; you easily get nearly a tablespoon more juice (watch the mfg video) It handles all sizes of citrus without having to make any adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: ANNE O.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Does an excellent job on oranges and lemons. On medium pulp setting, the drain spout sometimes clogs (but I can just pour the juice out by tilting the whole bowl). High speed spin setting is nifty. Cleaning is not super quick, the pulp gets stuck in the holes, but not super tedious either.
customer_reviews.author: Akom

customer_reviews.title: On the fence, but drinking lemonade.
customer_reviews.text: It does juice effectively, but Its not 5-star perfect. I first tried 5 firm little limes and a lemon. I got more juice from each and I would have given up at 3 using my manual reamer. But for those who wonder, it does take some strength to press the fruit continuously. The reverse spin to get the max juice is great. Biggest problem, it blew the GFI outlet 4-5 times during this one use.
customer_reviews.author: Katydu2

customer_reviews.title: Huge amounts of juice
customer_reviews.text: I have a lemon tree that produces a lot of lemons. I juiced all of them with far less effort over the other juicers I've tried. The pulp amount control was also great as I was able to choose based on whether I was making lemonade (lots of pulp) or juicing for recipes (no pulp). I absolutely love this juicer.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Combes

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly designed, poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in design, function and Cuisinart. The small hole leading to spout became clogged repeatedly, and I had to stop and unclog it. Pulp basket doesn't drain well, even though I had it set on "high pulp." Ridges on cone are so shallow they don't clean out pulp unless you press very hard. Motor is so weak that the spin cycle does hardly anything. Returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Knopfler

customer_reviews.title: STILL USING THIS PRODUCT 4 YRS LATER
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd citric juicer from Cuisinart I've bought. The first one for a disabled family member at least 4 yrs ago. It's used in his home 2 - 3 x's daily for large grapefruit and 2 lemons. It's still in use daily. I recently bought one for me, and the other I bought for a Christmas gift for my 87yr old neighbor/friend to juice a lemon daily, and gain the amazing health benefits from it. She adds the lemon juice to 32 oz of water and drinks throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value
customer_reviews.text: This is the best juicer for any citrus. I make my own lemon juice yearly, I freeze it in wide month quart Mason jars. I thought my present Cuisinart juicer was finally going to quit after 5 years and purchased a replacement. The new juicer is still no used yet. The old juicer is still working Awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: EQ

customer_reviews.title: not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of lime juice and this was not great. It was loud. The reverse mechanism makes a terrible click and pops the strainer out of place each time it reverses. Also, I thought the lid was used to hold the fruit on the juicer: you actually use your hands. I have carpal tunnel and this was very hard and painful for me.
customer_reviews.author: Arose.M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use/clean. Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I extremely happy with this product purchase. I wanted this mainly for limes because juicing them by hand can become a chore. This product works great. It easily comes apart without locking mechanisms in order to wash it off. It obviously has an electronic sound when using, but not too loud. The power cord is long enough as well. Very very happy with the purchase. You simply cut the citrus in half and press it down on the pressure activated top portion.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Guerriero

customer_reviews.title: Effective, easy to use, and reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I have an orange tree which gave me so many oranges this year. Last week, I spent 2 hours to manually squeeze about 30 oranges and it was very tiresome and messy. So I found this one on Amazon which has good rating and affordable. It arrived today and I tried it immediately. It works like a charm! I didn’t use the clear top though, only with a little push of my palm and I could be able to “empty” all the inside of the orange. No splashing, no mess. I’m really happy. It took me no time to finish the whole basket of oranges. No splashing, no mess! Thank you Cuisinart (and Amazon, too)! Hope it lasts long 🤞
customer_reviews.author: thanhxuan nguyen

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC juicer!
customer_reviews.text: I use lemons and limes a lot in my cooking. I had purchased a handheld juicer but it broke. This machine was fabulous and got much more juice out of the lemons than I anticipated. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because some of the seeds get into the juice. Otherwise, it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn M. Bsharah

customer_reviews.title: Too much plastic. The pulp strainer is a nightmare ...
customer_reviews.text: Too much plastic. The pulp strainer is a nightmare to adjust. I have to hold the base of the machine to keep it steady.
customer_reviews.author: cdb4

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a must if you juice much..
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! Very light weight so can easily store in a cabinet, yet balanced so well, no accidently knocking it over when juicing. Takes basically no pressure to hold the fruit on the rotator while it juices and gets so much more juice than my old manual one. Clean up is easy. Wish I'd had this years ago!!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: It works but...
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to use it but it works just ok for me. Because the wedges are kind of low, I had to press, squeeze and rotate the orange halves. Same with the tangerines. The pulps kind of stayed to the sides of the strainer so I had to scraped them out. Don’t think I will keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Abc

customer_reviews.title: Plastic parts break
customer_reviews.text: I bought this juicer on 9/7/17. After a while, the spout that sends the juice into the container came loose. For the last several months it has been possible to put it back in place although not perfectly. As of a couple of weeks ago, the spout broke off and can not be reinserted. A year and a couple of months is not long enough for this to last. I am going to try to get Cuisinart to replace the whole plastic assembly, but this is a real nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Herzberg

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CCJ-500 Pulp Control Citrus Juicer, Brushed Stainless, Black/Stainless, 1 Piece
product_meta.description:
Color:Black/StainlessPulp control citrus Juicer, adjustable reamer with 3 pulp control settings, low, medium & high, auto, reversing universal Juicer Cone, final spin feature, extra long snap up spout, brushed stain stainless steel design, dishwasher safe parts, cord storage. Never put the motor housing in water or other liquid to clean Features: Adjustable reamer with 3 pulp control settings-low medium high|Auto-reversing universal juicer cone for more efficient juicing|Final-Spin feature extracts more juice from pulp|Extra-long Snap-Up spout accommodates more glasses and prevents dripping'|Juicing cone accommodates small limes to large grapefruits|Cover activates Final-Spin feature and protects against dust|Brushed stainless steel design|Easy-clean dishwasher-safe parts|Convenient cord storage|Limited 3-year warranty|BPA Free

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Adjustable reamer with 3 pulp control settings-low, medium, high
Auto-reversing universal juicer cone for more efficient juicing
Final-Spin feature extracts more juice from pulp
Extra-long Snap-Up spout accommodates more glasses and prevents dripping
Brushed stainless steel design, Easy-clean dishwasher-safe parts, BPA free
NOTE: Refer user manual before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,362 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
